title: Rock Star Ric Ocasek Is Dead
text:
The Cars, with Ric Ocasek in center, perform live at Old Waldorf in 1979 in San Francisco.

NEW YORK— Ric Ocasek, famed frontman for The Cars rock band, has been found dead in a Manhattan apartment.

Ric Ocasek in 1980 Photo: Lynn Goldsmith/ZUMA Press

The New York City Police Department said officers responding to a 911 call found the 75-year-old Mr. Ocasek at about 4 p.m. on Sunday. They said there was no sign of foul play and that the medical examiner was to determine a cause of death.

The Cars’ chart-topping hits in the late 1970s and 1980s included “Just What I Needed,” ‘‘Shake It Up” and “Drive.” The band was inducted last year into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. In May of 2018, model and actress Paulina Porizkova announced on social media that she and Mr. Ocasek had separated after 28 years of marriage. The pair first met while filming the music video for “Drive.” Related Eddie Money, Who Sang ‘Two Tickets to Paradise,’ Dies at Age 70 (Sept. 13)

Anatomy of a Song: The Story Behind the Cars’ ‘My Best Friend’s Girl’ (April 23, 2018) —Copyright 2019 the Associated Press
